You have an Azure subscription that includes an app named App1.

You have an Azure DevOps project that contains two environments named Staging and Production.

You use Azure Pipelines to deploy App1.

You need to validate the performance of App1 in the Staging environment before it is deployed to Production. The solution must minimize administrative effort.

What should you do in the Azure DevOps project?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Requirement is to monitor Staging, and D is Staging

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer. Adding a check in the Staging environment to query Azure Monitor Alerts ensures that the app’s performance is validated before it moves to Production.

choices.A: In the production branch policy, add a status check to query Azure Monitor Alerts for active alerts.
choices.C: In the Production environment stage, add a post-deployment approval for the Azure Monitor Alerts group.
choices.B: In the Production environment, add a check to query Azure Monitor Alerts for active alerts.
choices.D: In the Staging environment add a check to query Azure Monitor Alerts for active alerts.

You need to use an Azure Pipelines pipeline to build and test an app and test the database of the app. The solution must meet the following requirements.

• The test stages must be run in parallel.
• The Publish_Test_Results stage must always be run.
• The test stages must be run after successful completion of the build stage.
• The Publish_Test_Results stage must be run after completion of all the test stages.

Solution: You include the following elements in the YAML definition of the pipeline.

//IMG//


Does this meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
1. The Test Stages Must Run in Parallel:
Test App and Test Database stages both depend on Build_App, and no dependencies are defined between them. This allows the two test stages to run in parallel after the Build_App stage completes.
2.The Publish_Test_Results Stage Must Always Be Run:
The condition: always() in the Publish_Test_Results stage ensures that it will run regardless of the success or failure of any preceding stages.
3.The Test Stages Must Be Run After Successful Completion of the Build Stage:
Both Test App and Test Database stages explicitly depend on Build_App (dependsOn: [Build_App]), ensuring they only start after Build_App completes successfully.
4.The Publish_Test_Results Stage Must Be Run After Completion of All the Test Stages:
The Publish_Test_Results stage includes dependsOn: [Build_App, Test App, Test_Database], ensuring it will only execute after all preceding stages (including the test stages) have finished.
